this_title: It Don't Cost Nothin' to Say Good Morning
introduction: It Don't Cost Nothin' to Say Good Morning is a 1994 documentary film directed by Kenny Hotz and Spencer Rice. The film is about the life of a homeless man, known only as "'Shorty' Gordy", who was a drunken, potty-mouthed panhandler, which was filmed over many years, covering Gordy's life and death. The movie premiered at Palm Springs Film Festival, Cinéfest, The Worldwide Short Film Festival and was nominated for the best short at "Hot Docs Film Festival."
